facts.text: A temple is built on the Capitoline Hill dedicated to Venus Erycina to commemorate the Roman defeat at Lake Trasimene.
King Brian Boru of Ireland defeats Viking forces at Battle of Clontarf freeing Ireland from foreign control
Damascus surrenders to sultan Nur ad-Din van Aleppo
Ferdinand III of Castile conquers CÃ¡ceres.
St. George's Night Uprising in Estonia
1st English order of knighthood founded (Order of Garter)
Pedro Cabral lands & annexes Brazil (Terra da Vera Cruz)
Portuguese navigator Pedro Cabral & 6 ships return to Lisbon
King Maximilian I routes troops to Bavaria
Duke Wilhelm IV of Bavaria endorses "The German Beer Purity Law" (Reinheitsgebot) and adds to it standards for the sale of beer
William Shakespeare's The Merry Wives of Windsor is first performed, with Queen Elizabeth I of England in attendance.
Netherlands buys De Briel/Vlissingen/Fort Rammekens from England
